Subject: Problems with steady state of Well stirred reactor
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=253888987; y=dTdUnzfQiKkf-N1zR4qwCryRAgZ8LhcuwyydlSYzGJrU7YHRGSOA2w

Dear Prof.Goodwin,

I am an undergraduate student from Indian Institute of
=
Technology,Bombay,India.I am working on a project which involves
comparison=
 of results obtained by cantera to calculated results.
I am trying to work =
out  steady state solution of propane combustion
in a spherical well-stirre=
d-thermo-chemical reactor.Unlike the
example on periodic_cstr, where the in=
itial temperature of the reactor
is known, my problem has the assumption th=
at the reactants reach the
exit temperature as soon as they enter the react=
or. However, the
temperature of the entering species in known(propane-air m=
ixture at
stoichiometric proportions at 298 K).With the initial guess of re=
actor
temperature to be 1700K, I get the results, which differ considerably=

from the results obtained without cantera, involving assumptions of a
simp=
le chemical reaction. other conditions are;
i)No mass and heat transfer at =
the wall.

For example, some results obtained are:
mass flow rate(kg/sec)  =
    Texit(calculated)(K)     T(cantera)
0.1                           2400 =
                   1964
0.2                           2297                 =
   1959

I would be very grateful if you could look into the details and
su=
ggest some solution.Moreover, is there any way to model PFR in cantera.

wa=
iting for your response.

sincerely,

Deep Gupta

attached here is the prog=
ram which i am using for cantera;

clear all;
gas=3DGRI30;
set(gas,'T',298,=
'P',oneatm,'X','C3H8:1,N2:18.8,O2:5');

%creating an upstream object
upstre=
am=3D Reservoir(gas);
mdot =3D 0.1;   % kg/s%
mfc =3D MassFlowController;
i=
nstall(mfc, upstream, r);%connecting to the reactor
setMassFlowRate(mfc, md=
ot);


%creating a reactor object
set(gas,'T',1700,'P',oneatm);
r=3DReactor=
(gas);
setInitialVolume(r, 2.68*1.0e-4);

%creating a downstream object
dow=
nstream =3D Reservoir(gas);
mfc2 =3D MassFlowController;
install(mfc2, r, d=
ownstream);
setMassFlowRate(mfc2, mdot);


network=3DReactorNet({r});
t =3D=
 0.0;
dt =3D0.1;
n=3D1;
temp(1)=3Dtemperature(r);
temp(2)=3Dtemp(1)+0.1;
t(=
1)=3D0;
while(abs(temp(n)-temp(n+1))>10^(-3))
       t(n+1) =3D t(n) + dt;
=
        n=3Dn+1;     
  advance(network, t(n));
  temp(n+1) =3D temperature=
(r);
   end
temp(n+1)
